briefdescription.para: Initial state.
Conference is now instantiated locally.
One creation request was sent to the service.
Conference was created on the service.
Conference creation on service failed.
Wait for conference termination.
The conference is terminated locally, though it may still exist on the service for other participants.
Conference termination failed.
Conference was deleted locally and on the service.
LinphoneConferenceState is used to indicate the current state of a conference.
Grid - each participant is given an equal sized image size.
Active speaker - participant who speaks is prominently displayed in the center of the screen and other participants are minimized.
LinphoneConferenceLayout is used to indicate the layout used by the conference.
Participants must dial the conference server.
Conference server dials participants.
Mode of joining conference.

simplesect.para: It is only valid at the creation of the conferece

briefdescription.para: Only participants in the initiating INVITE are allowed to join the conference.
All devices calling the conference URI are allowed to join the conference.
Type of conference participant list.

detaileddescription.para: When participant list is closed, no more participants can be added other than those declared when creating the conference When participant list is open, other people can join the conference upon invitation of a participant no more participants can be added other than those declared when creating the conference

briefdescription.para: No security.
Point-to-point encryption.
End-to-end encryption.
Conference minimum security level.
Default state of a freshly created LinphoneConferenceScheduler.
An error has happened during conference creation.
Conference creation is in progress.
Confererence has been created.
Conference has been updated.
Describes conference scheduler possible states.

detaileddescription.para: It is notified via the conference_scheduler_state_changed callback in LinphoneConferenceSchedulerCbs.

briefdescription.para: New conference.
Conference has been updated.
Canceling a conference.
LinphoneConferenceInfoState is used to list all states of a conference info object
participant is a speaker in the conference
participant is a listener in the conference.

detaileddescription.para: He/She cannot speak

briefdescription.para: participant role is unknown
LinphoneParticipantRole is used to define a role of a participant within a conference
an INVITE has been sent
the SIP session has been concluded, participant is part of the conference
A BYE is pending.
The Session is terminated.
Initial state for the server group chatroom, when the participant has not yet been INVITEd.
Transitional state for a participant that will receive a BYE shortly.
the SIP session has been concluded, participant is not media mixed
180 Ringing
Some medias have been muted by the focus.
LinphoneParticipantDeviceState is used to list all states a participant device can be in
device called the conference
device is called the conference
device is the focus
LinphoneParticipantDeviceJoiningMethod is used to indicate how a participant joined a conference or if it is the focus.
an admin removes the device from a conference
the device disconnects from the conference
device is busy
an error occurred while the device is leaving the conference or he declined a call from the server
LinphoneParticipantDeviceDisconnectionMethod is used to indicate how a participant left a conference.
Callback used to notify a conference that a participant has been added.

parameterdescription.para: LinphoneParticipant that has been added to the conference

briefdescription.para: Callback used to notify a conference that a participant has been removed.

parameterdescription.para: LinphoneParticipant that has been removed to the conference

In case of error for some participants, their addresses will be given as parameter.
conference_scheduler
LinphoneConferenceScheduler object whose state has changed.
failed_invitations
a list of addresses for which invitation couldn't be sent. LinphoneAddress

briefdescription.para: A conference is the object that allow to make calls when there are 2 or more participants.

detaileddescription.para: To create (or find) a LinphoneConference, you first need a LinphoneConferenceParams object. linphone_core_create_conference_with_params() allows you to create a conference. A conference is uniquely identified by a conference address, meaning you can have more than one conference between two accounts. As of now, each LinphoneCore can host only 1 conference but it can be part of many conferences as a remote participant. To find a conference among those a core is part of, you can call linphone_core_search_conference().

briefdescription.para: Object defining parameters for a LinphoneConference.

detaileddescription.para: Can be created by calling function linphone_core_create_conference_params_2().

briefdescription.para: An object to handle the callbacks for the handling a LinphoneConference objects.

detaileddescription.para: Use linphone_factory_create_conference_cbs() to create an instance. Then pass the object to a LinphoneConference instance through linphone_conference_add_callbacks().

briefdescription.para: Object defining all information related to a conference.
Object used to create remote conferences and send ICS to notify participants.
Identifies a member of a LinphoneConference or LinphoneChatRoom.

detaileddescription.para: A participant is identified by it's SIP address. It can have many LinphoneParticipantDevice.

briefdescription.para: Object defining all information related to a participant.
This object represents a unique device for a member of a LinphoneConference or LinphoneChatRoom.

detaileddescription.para: Devices are identified by the gruu parameter inside the LinphoneAddress which can be obtained by linphone_participant_device_get_address(). It is specially usefull to know the security level of each device inside an end-to-end encrypted LinphoneChatRoom.
You can get a list of all LinphoneParticipantDevice using linphone_participant_get_devices().

briefdescription.para: An object to handle the callbacks for the handling a LinphoneParticipantDevice objects.

detaileddescription.para: Use linphone_factory_create_participant_device_cbs() to create an instance. Then pass the object to a LinphoneParticipantDevice instance through linphone_participant_device_add_callbacks().

briefdescription.para: This object represents the delivery/display state of a given chat message for a given participant.

detaileddescription.para: It also contains a timestamp at which this participant state has changed.

Use linphone_chat_message_get_participants_by_imdn_state() to get all LinphoneParticipantImdnState for a given state. From there use linphone_participant_imdn_state_get_participant() to get the LinphoneParticipant object if you need it.

briefdescription.para: This object is only used on server side for LinphoneChatRoom with LinphoneChatRoomBackendFlexisipChat backend.
LinphoneConferenceState is used to indicate the current state of a conference.
LinphoneConferenceLayout is used to indicate the layout used by the conference.

detaileddescription.para: When participant list is closed, no more participants can be added other than those declared when creating the conference When participant list is open, other people can join the conference upon invitation of a participant no more participants can be added other than those declared when creating the conference

briefdescription.para: Conference minimum security level.

LinphoneParticipantDeviceState is used to list all states a participant device can be in
LinphoneParticipantDeviceJoiningMethod is used to indicate how a participant joined a conference or if it is the focus.
LinphoneParticipantDeviceDisconnectionMethod is used to indicate how a participant left a conference.
Create a conference.

detaileddescription.para:
Local or remote conference is determinated from the 'conference_type' variable in the 'misc' section of the configuration, or by the factory address parameter. See linphone_conference_params_set_conference_factory_address() for more details.
core
The LinphoneCore instance where the conference will be created inside.
params
Parameters of the conference. See LinphoneConferenceParams.
A pointer on the freshly created conference LinphoneConference. That object will be automatically freed by the core after calling linphone_core_terminate_conference().

briefdescription.para: Create a conference scheduler that can be used to create remote conferences for now or later and then send conference info as an ICS through chat.

simplesect.para: A pointer on the freshly created LinphoneConferenceScheduler.

briefdescription.para: Find a conference.

parameterdescription.para: The conference parameters to match LinphoneConferenceParams or NULL
LinphoneAddress representing the local proxy configuration or NULL
LinphoneAddress to search for or NULL
The participants that must be present in the chat room to find LinphoneAddress

simplesect.para: A pointer on LinphoneConference satisfying the non-NULL function arguments or NULL if none matches

briefdescription.para: Find a conference.

simplesect.para: A pointer on LinphoneConference whose conference address is the one provided as argument or NULL if none matches

briefdescription.para: Add a participant to the conference.

detaileddescription.para:
If no conference is going on a new internal conference context is created and the participant is added to it.
core
LinphoneCore
call
The current call with the participant to add
0 if succeeded. Negative number if failed

briefdescription.para: Add all current calls into the conference.

detaileddescription.para:
If no conference is running a new internal conference context is created and all current calls are added to it.
core
LinphoneCore
0 if succeeded. Negative number if failed
This function guarantees that the local endpoint is added to the conference.

briefdescription.para: Remove a call from the conference.

detaileddescription.para:
core
the linphone core
call
a call that has been previously merged into the conference.
After removing the remote participant belonging to the supplied call, the call becomes a normal call in paused state. If one single remote participant is left alone together with the local user in the conference after the removal, then the conference is automatically transformed into a simple call in StreamsRunning state. The conference's resources are then automatically destroyed.
In other words, unless linphone_core_leave_conference() is explicitly called, the last remote participant of a conference is automatically put in a simple call in running state.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, -1 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Indicates whether the local participant is part of a conference.

simplesect.para: That function automatically fails in the case of conferences using a conferencet server (focus). If you use such a conference, you should use linphone_conference_remove_participant() instead.
TRUE if the local participant is in a conference, FALSE otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Join the local participant to the running conference.

simplesect.para: 0 if succeeded. Negative number if failed

briefdescription.para: Make the local participant leave the running conference.

simplesect.para: 0 if succeeded. Negative number if failed

briefdescription.para: Get the set input volume of the local participant.

simplesect.para: A value inside [0.0 ; 1.0]

briefdescription.para: Terminate the running conference.

detaileddescription.para:
If it is a local conference, all calls inside it will become back separate calls and will be put in LinphoneCallPaused state. If it is a conference involving a focus server, all calls inside the conference will be terminated.
core
LinphoneCore
0 if succeeded. Negative number if failed
